Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of uncertain subject (arm of figure holding a pelta, seen from inside with strap in faded colour and part of a spear shaft).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "6" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0233) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
